Class CooFieldEquals

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.linalg.ops.sparse.coo.field_ops.CooFieldEquals
public final class CooFieldEquals extends Object

This utility class contains methods for checking the equality, or approximately equal, of sparse COO tensors whose data are field elements.

    Checks that all non-zero data are "close" according to RealProperties.allClose(double[], double[]) and * all indices are the same.

  • Method Details

    • cooTensorEquals

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean cooTensorEquals(AbstractCooFieldTensor<?,?,T> a, AbstractCooFieldTensor<?,?,T> b)
      Checks if two real sparse tensors are real. Assumes the indices of each sparse tensor are sorted. Any explicitly stored zero's will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      a - First tensor in the equality check.
      b - Second tensor in the equality check.
      Returns:
      True if the tensors are equal. False otherwise.

    • cooMatrixEquals

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean cooMatrixEquals(AbstractCooFieldMatrix<?,?,?,T> a, AbstractCooFieldMatrix<?,?,?,T> b)
      Checks if two real sparse matrices are real. Assumes the indices of each sparse matrix are sorted. Any explicitly stored zero's will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      a - First matrix in the equality check.
      b - Second matrix in the equality check.
      Returns:
      True if the matrices are equal. False otherwise.

    • cooVectorEquals

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean cooVectorEquals(AbstractCooFieldVector<?,?,?,?,T> a, AbstractCooFieldVector<?,?,?,?,T> b)
      Checks if two real sparse vectors are real. Assumes the indices of each sparse vector are sorted. Any explicitly stored zero's will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      a - First vector in the equality check.
      b - Second vector in the equality check.
      Returns:
      True if the vectors are equal. False otherwise.

    • allClose

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean allClose(AbstractCooFieldMatrix<?,?,?,T> src1, AbstractCooFieldMatrix<?,?,?,T> src2, double relTol, double absTol)
      Checks that all non-zero data are "close" according to RealProperties.allClose(double[], double[]) and * all indices are the same.
      Parameters:
      src1 - First matrix in comparison.
      src2 - Second matrix in comparison.
      relTol - Relative tolerance.
      absTol - Absolute tolerance.
      Returns:
      True if all data are "close". Otherwise, false.

    • allClose

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean allClose(AbstractCooFieldTensor<?,?,T> src1, AbstractCooFieldTensor<?,?,T> src2, double relTol, double absTol)
      Checks that all non-zero data are "close" according to RingProperties.allClose(Ring[], Ring[], double, double) and all indices are the same.
      Parameters:
      src1 - First tensor in comparison.
      src2 - Second tensor in comparison.
      relTol - Relative tolerance.
      absTol - Absolute tolerance.
      Returns:
      True if all data are "close". Otherwise, false.

    • allClose

      public static <T extends Field<T>> boolean allClose(AbstractCooFieldVector<?,?,?,?,T> src1, AbstractCooFieldVector<?,?,?,?,T> src2, double relTol, double absTol)
      Checks that all non-zero data are "close" according to
      invalid reference 
      RingProperties#allClose(Field[], Field[])
      and all indices are the same.
      Parameters:
      src1 - First vector in comparison.
      src2 - Second vector in comparison.
      relTol - Relative tolerance.
      absTol - Absolute tolerance.
      Returns:
      True if all data are "close". Otherwise, false.
